runs.comm: full outside off, perhaps held back a bit by Anwar, driven without any timing and it runs to midwicket
a straighter delivery and it's a punchy piece of timing by Roy as he drives it wide of mid-on
nearly an edge, short of a length outside off, some extra bounce, Hales goes to play square through the off side

all happening! Hales nearly run-out. A full delivery was driven firmly into the ground, Anwar stuck a hand up in his follow through then hurled it back at the stumps with Hales out of his ground...he dived but would have been out with a direct hit
a wristy stroke to get off the mark, taken off the stumps into the leg side
angled into the pads, flicked off his hip to deep square
full, way down the leg side, a tumbling take for Sarfraz
on leg stump, worked out to deep square leg

dropped, eventually! Hales pops a length delivery back to Tanvir in his follow through, trying to work to the leg side, it loops back to Tanvir to his right, he firstly sticks out a hand and can't hold on, but parries it up and he grassed the second take which actually came very gently to him
short again, pulled off the front foot through straight midwicket
flicks from off stump into the leg side
picks the slower ball and goes clean down the ground, in the air over mid-off...was a full delivery, but not a half volley, Roy hammered it on the up
taken this time! Short of a length and Roy splices his pull to mid-on where a simple catch is taken. Didn't get any power or timing on this occasion
full outside off, Hales across his crease and plays to midwicket
this goes miles in the air but lands in space...Hales came down the pitch and picked this up from outside off, over midwicket, low down on the bat but falls safely at deep midwicket
leading edge, caught at mid-off! Both openers gone now. A back-of-a-length delivery, Hales looking to work into the leg side and the thick leading edge carries at head height to Afridi at mid-off
pushed across on a length outside off, left alone...England need to take a breath for a moment
back of a length outside off, driven to mid-off
this ball stops on the pitch a little, perhaps a slower one, but Moeen stops himself going too hard into his forward push
good delivery, first ball to Vince, tight to the body on middle and leg, defended down by his feet
short of a length at leg stump, Vince can't make contact and the ball deflects to the off side
play and a miss as he drives at a full delivery outside off
fraction shorter and tighter to off stump, Moeen pushes square into the covers
finds cover! Fantastic start for Pakistan. Moeen comes forward, drives on the up, but picks out cover who just had to move a little to his right and snaffle a simple catch
back of a length at off stump, carefully defended to the covers
full on the stumps, defended to the covers
uses his feet, comes down outside leg stump, but it's a short-of-a-length delivery and Vince can only push to cover
dragged down short, quite sweetly pulled by Vince and it isn't far from reaching deep square leg
on the pads, pushed through midwicket but the man at deep square is quickly around
more fresh air from an England batsman, Vince again using his feet on the line of leg stump to open up the off side but the ball bounces over the top edge
gets this through the in-field, stays in his crease this time, the ball is fuller around off stump and he drives between cover and mid-off
starts short and wide, Morgan takes advantage with a strong square cut off the front foot which rockets through the covers
just over midwicket! Morgan goes to pull another short one from outside off, got a little cramped for room, and he spooned it just out of reach of midwicket
short on leg stump, Vince swivels on a very compact pull off his hip which quickly finds its way to the long-leg boundary
pushed into the off side for a sharp single, Morgan has to stretch to make his ground but the throw missed from cover
short of a length outside off, 85mph, takes a thickish outside edge down to third man
that's a terrific stroke, gives himself a touch of room to the leg side and then drills a length delivery wide of mid-off...lovely timing and impressive confidence on debut
tucked to the leg side
driven square through point to the sweeper
this is a straighter delivery, slides on, takes Vince's inside edge into the pads
fuller, he aims to the leg side, takes a leading edge back down the pitch
dragged down very short but Vince can't get much timing into his pull out to deep midwicket
nice touch from Morgan as he allows this delivery outside off to slide off the face through short third man
full outside off, dabbed to the right of backward point
back of a length, 77mph, driven to cover
opens the face into the off side
very good bowling, gets this in at Vince's feet as he tries to come down the pitch and he can only work it down the ground
dragged down short, angled into the body, Morgan gets it away with a well-controlled pull behind square and beats long leg
taken from way outside off and shovelled into midwicket
a googly which he pushed to cover
places this one very well, powers it through the off side, was a touch short by Afridi
worked off the pads out to deep square
attempts the reverse sweep, a full, straight delivery, but he can't make contact
full and straight, he can't get it away as he drives back to the bowler
good placement this time, a sweet drive as he makes a late adjustment with his wrists to send it wide of long-off
goes down on his back knee and slog-sweeps the medium-pacer - it was a slower ball, too - sending it over deep square leg for the first six...just had the distance
drives down to long off
full on off stump, driven down the ground
this loopy slower ball is off target down the leg side
another variation of the slower ball, back-of-the-hand this time, and it defeats Vince's drive
takes a stride down the pitch and drives sweetly to long off
full and straight, another single straight to end the over
brings out the reverse sweep again, gets it very fine off a bottom edge which beats Sarfraz
opens the face and places this into the backward-point area
beats him on the cut, was a delivery to hit but perhaps defeated by that 'Afridi skid'
sweeps this time but gets taken on the pads
huge full toss outside off, Vince picks midwicket as his area, clubs across the line and makes good value out of the poor delivery
now he drives along the ground through the covers to the sweeper...he's going well
resumes with a short one which is pulled over midwicket, came from quite high on the bat
full and straight, slower ball at 67mph, driven to long-off
full outside off, a mighty swing and a miss from Vince as he aims for that strong area through cover
a full, wide, dipping slower ball this time he defeats Vince who didn't spot it and could only jab his bat out
goes across the crease this time, ends up on his back knee as he plays a variation of a slog sweep but finds midwicket
full and straight, 87mph, driven to Afridi who is deep at cover and he lets it through his legs but the sweeper ensures it is just a single
angled into the pads, rebounds to the off side and there's a quick call for the single
down the pitch and that's a huge blow into the second or third tier of the stand over long-on, lovely swift footwork to get him to the pitch and a clean strike
tucked off the pads to the leg side
a very well placed sweep from Vince this time, takes it from around off stump but he uses Afridi's pace and sends it wide of short fine leg
full, drilled down to long off...a small fumble by Anwar but stays at the single
outside off, cut to deep point
a slower ball full at off stump, opens the face and finds backward point
short outside off, Morgan tries to guide it down to third man but gets beaten
this is good from Wahab, another dot ball as he gets this very straight at Morgan, no room to free his arms and can only block it
beaten and a big appeal for caught behind! Good pace, Morgan was a little late on his shot, a short-of-a-length delivery which he tried to steer away. It carried over middle stump.
manages to scamper one this time, pushes a shortish delivery just to the right of Wahab in his follow through...the bowler dived but couldn't quite reach it. Good commitment
you miss, I hit! That over deserved reward, excellent pressure built. Vince has a heave across the line of a slower delivery, superb bowling,and the off stump gets struck.
lobs a length delivery in the air through the leg side with a straight bat
uses his feet and works a straight delivery through the leg side
uses his feet and makes this into a low full toss which is tucked to long on
a short delivery, no pace to work with, flipped into the leg side
full and straight, worked down the ground...100 on the board for England, a decent recovery
slower ball on the pads, flicked to deep square leg...just singles in the last two overs
angled across outside off, beats Billings as he tries to run it down to third man
gets it over backward point as he drives with a strong flick of his wrists to get just enough elevation...out of binary numbers
there's his scoop! He's known for it like Buttler. This is superb. He gets right across outside off and picks this up off the stumps, lofting it over short fine leg. Kids these days, eh
back of a length outside off, driven on the up into the covers
on the stumps, no width to work with, pushed down the ground
comes down the pitch and brilliantly flicks a straight delivery over midwicket with placement...such skill of Billings to work the gaps. Fantastically quick wrists
dropped, that could be a big moment! Imran Khan at short third man. Morgan cut at a ball with some width, takes a top edge and should have been taken to his left
full outside off, swing and a miss as he gives himself some room
full outside off, swipe out to deep square leg along the ground
a yorker, outside off, excellent delivery and he can only squeeze it to the off side
a full, wide, slower delivery, driven in the towards long off and the fielder does not charge in for the catch, instead allows it to bounce, and says he lost the ball
starts to shape for another scoop, this time it's a short ball outside off, so slow it's almost in reverse by the time it reaches Billings, he doesn't make contact but gets a run off edge and body
fetches this delivery from off stump, a back-of-the-hand slower ball, and he crunches it off the front foot through midwicket
now he goes straight down the ground, wonderful strokeplay from Billings, brings his bottom hand into play after using his feet and sends it racing straight down the ground
all the way this time! Billings turning it on. Another slower one (too many?), Billings is down the pitch again and this time picks it up squarer over the leg-side boundary
flogs a full toss down the ground, long on can get around this time
full outside off, got too close to the ball this time and just forces it into the off side
low full toss outside off, swung down the ground, along the deck, long on is around but can't stop the second
another Billscoop (sorry, I've nicked that), this time a full delivery outside off, Billings is all the way across his crease, gets under the ball and lofts it very fine. Stunning.

he's done it again! Six this time. Incredible batting. Pushed even wider outside off, but Billings just does what he likes - wanders across - and lofts it over fine leg with the scoop. Applause from Buttler in the dug out
round the wicket, a low full toss outside off, he misses out
a short ball this time, slower one at 73mph, Billings is early on his swat and doesn't make contact
back on a length, angling into Billings, heaved through the leg side wide of long on...that's the 150 for England
full outside off, jabbed through the covers and these two are rapid between the wickets. Onto 49 off 23 balls
full and wide, jabbed down to third man off the toe end
round the wicket, full and straight, drilled back past the bowler who tried to get a foot to it...takes him to a 24-ball fifty. What an effort
short, top edge into midwicket, but lands in the vast space on the leg side
this one is over the keeper as he plays another sweep/scoop/swipe, came off the top edge (or back of the bat) and Wahab does very well to chase it down to the third-man boundary
full and driven straight down the ground
no, it's a dot ball (and a run out) as Morgan swings across the line of a slower ball...Sarfraz gathers and hits the stumps underarm as they try to steal a bye
